SourcedStatement: The California Nurses Association (CNA), the largest union of registered nurses in the state, sponsored SB 1015 to support nursing students seeking placement in the workforce.
Name: California Nurses Association (CNA)
Justification: the largest union of registered nurses in the state, sponsored SB 1015

SourcedStatement: According to the Board of Registered Nursing, 92 out of 152 publicly funded nursing programs were denied access to clinic placements.

Justification: reported that 92 out of 152 publicly funded nursing programs were denied access to clinic placements

SourcedStatement: The program officials reported that the inability to secure clinical placements is one of the main reasons for not enrolling more students.

SourcedStatement: “As California’s population ages and becomes increasingly more diverse, we will need a qualified and experienced nursing workforce to meet the unique demands and varied needs of all patients. That is why we must have appropriate nurse staffing levels which have proven to reduce mortality rates, reduce hospital length of stays, and reduce the number of preventable events such as falls and infections,” said Cortese.
Name: Sen. Dave Cortese
Title: Sen. Dave Cortese (D-San Jose)

SourcedStatement: “Clinical education is an essential part of any nurse’s education, yet aspiring nurses, especially students in public programs, are being denied access to clinical placements,” said Kennedy.
Name: Cathy Kennedy
Title: Registered Nurse and president of the CNA

SourcedStatement: “We applaud the California Senate for passing S.B. 1015. It is commonsense reform that will increase transparency and increase oversight from the Board of Registered Nursing,” she added.
